summary_md: This round established core local structure for finite Whitney triangulations of the disk and advanced the classification of maximal cliques in kG when an interior edge is shared. Proven: G is K4-free so maximal cliques of the primal are exactly facial triangles; the link of any interior vertex is a chordless cycle, hence interior degree ≥4; for interior v the incident-face set T(v) is a maximal clique in kG; any interior face with all three edges interior yields N(t) that induces a maximal K4 in kG; kG is connected for graphs with ≥2 faces. New structural lemmas: a local Helly lemma across an interior edge, and Proposition 13 classifying any maximal clique containing two faces that share an interior edge (it is T(u), T(v), N(t) or N(g)). Verified k-nullness for fans, the two-face disk, and the hexagon-with-central-triangle. Remaining major gap: classification of maximal cliques with no edge-sharing pair and a completed outerplanar ear-removal proof. Citations: Research Notes; Rigorous Proofs; Verifier Summary.
one_line_summary: Shared-edge clique classification proved; non-edge-sharing cliques and outerplanar proof remain.
highlights: G is K4-free ⇒ maximal cliques of the primal are exactly facial triangles.
Link of any interior vertex is a chordless cycle ⇒ interior degree ≥4; T(v) is a maximal clique in kG.
An interior face with three interior edges produces N(t) which induces a maximal K4 in kG.
kG is connected whenever G has at least two faces.
Local Helly across an interior edge: a face meeting both incident faces must contain one endpoint.
Proposition 13: any maximal clique containing two faces sharing an interior edge equals T(u), T(v), N(t) or N(g).
Verified k-null for fans, two-triangle disk, and hexagon+central triangle.
next_questions: Prove that any pairwise-intersecting family of facial triangles with no two sharing an edge has a common vertex (Helly-type) to complete clique classification.
Formalize the ear-removal induction for the outerplanar (no interior vertices) case to deduce k-nullness.
Exhaustively generate small Whitney disk triangulations (interior degrees 4–5) to search for counterexamples or supporting data.
